brief.title: Subscriptions Payments Service
brief.description: Design a payments microservice for subscriptions across US/EU with GDPR. We need near real-time confirmation, ledger accuracy, and resiliency. Traffic expected to grow. Consider PCI/PII implications.

EDR=0.23, IG*=0.00 -> Confident enough to propose a design

assumptions: System topology and coupling patterns are undefined without problem context
concerns: Critical unknowns prevent meaningful analysis of boundaries, data flows, or evolution risks
Lack of constraints/metrics obscures tradeoff evaluation
blockers: Absence of problem description or requirements prevents architecture assessment

question_candidates.q: What is the core functionality and user journey?
What are the scalability targets and compliance requirements?

ranked.q: What is the core functionality and user journey?
What are the scalability targets and compliance requirements?

reason: EDR=0.24, IG*=1.50 -> Confident enough to propose a design

assumptions: Service is user-facing with latency sensitivity
concerns: No SLO targets defined for latency/availability
Rollout strategy undefined - risk of unplanned outages
blockers: Missing core metrics prevents SLO formulation
Undefined RPO/RTO limits disaster recovery planning

key_decisions.rationale: Balances risk reduction with operational simplicity

question_candidates.q: What are target p99 latency and availability requirements?
What is maximum acceptable data loss duration (RPO)?

assumptions: Problem involves data flows needing integration patterns
Event-driven or API-based solution will be required
Idempotency and consistency are critical concerns
concerns: Insufficient problem details prevent meaningful design
Lack of constraints/metrics inhibits risk assessment
Undefined timelines may impact delivery planning
blockers: Missing problem description prevents solution design
Absence of must-haves blocks requirement analysis
No known risks/unknowns limits mitigation planning

question_candidates.q: What are the specific data sources/targets and consistency requirements?
What are the data volumes and latency SLOs?

assumptions: Problem context is missing but implies a greenfield system design
Minimal coupling and clear service boundaries will be primary goals
Evolvability will require explicit versioning and abstraction strategies
concerns: Critical unknowns prevent meaningful topology decisions
Missing constraints may lead to over-engineering
blockers: Absence of core problem statement or functional requirements
No clarity on data flows or domain boundaries

key_decisions.recommend: Defer decomposition until domain boundaries are clarified
key_decisions.rationale: Premature splitting risks coordination overhead without problem context

question_candidates.q: What are the core domain entities and their lifecycle ownership boundaries?
What are the non-functional requirements (scale, latency, compliance)?

assumptions: Problem context missing; assuming generic infrastructure reliability assessment
No specific SLO targets provided; will require domain input
System operates in single-region until scale justifies multi-region
concerns: Critical problem details undefined: latency requirements, traffic patterns, failure domains
Cannot define SLIs/SLOs without domain KPIs
Rollout strategy indeterminable without deployment environment context
blockers: No RTO/RPO requirements specified for disaster recovery planning
Absence of capacity projections prevents resource allocation

key_decisions.rationale: Balances operational insight with implementation cost for unknown systems

question_candidates.q: What are the top 3 user-facing latency requirements?
What is the maximum acceptable data loss duration (RPO)?

brief.title: Instagram Spam Detection System
brief.description: Design a scalable system to automatically identify and filter spam content across Instagram's platform. The solution should analyze user-generated content in real-time while minimizing false positives to maintain user experience.
